description: From the first delivery of an MG in January 2020, Chinese EV brands have since gone onto capture a combined market share of roughly 10% in Norway.

title: Trump threatens 100% tariffs on Russian export buyers unless Ukraine peace deal is reached by September
description: Trump's tariffs could hit China, India and Brazil especially hard. All three countries are top buyers of Russian fossil fuels.

description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Chaos On SpiceJet Flight After 2 Passengers Try To Forcibly Enter Cockpit
description: Two unruly passengers were offloaded from a SpiceJet flight at the Delhi airport on Monday after they attempted to forcefully enter the cockpit when the aircraft was taxiing.

title: "Tough Guy, Fooled A Lot Of People": Trump Blasts Putin As Ukraine War Intensifies
description: Ever since his political rise a decade ago, Donald Trump has sung the praises of Vladimir Putin -- the Russian president was a "strong leader" who, perhaps more important, would often say "very good things" about him.

title: Trump threatens Russia with tariffs while unveiling Ukraine weapons plan
description: Under the new plan, the US will sell weapons to Nato countries who will send them to Ukraine.

title: Trump weapons pledge marks major step forward for Ukraine
description: For the first time since returning to the White House, Trump pledges to make new weapons available to Ukraine.

title: It’s Paradise Lost as Climate Change Remakes Europe’s Summers
description: In peak vacation season, many of the continent’s most desirable getaways are becoming places to get away from.
author: Jason Horowitz

title: Plan to Indefinitely Displace Palestinians Threatens to Derail Gaza Truce
description: An Israeli proposal to force much of Gaza’s population into a small enclave is now overshadowing negotiations over a truce.
author: Patrick Kingsley and Aaron Boxerman

title: Rains and storms batter parts of US: Flash flood warning issued across New York City; state of emergency declared in New Jersey
description: Heavy rainfall triggered flash flood warnings across New York City and prompted New Jersey to declare a state of emergency. The rising water levels disrupted roads, airports, and public transport services. Residents were urged to stay indoors as the slow-moving storm system is expected to move south, increasing the flood risk for regions from North Carolina to southern New Jersey.
author: TOI World Desk

title: 'They just bombed a nursing home': Trump claims Melania's remarks pushed for stronger action on Russia; US president pledges billions for Ukraine
description: US President Trump revealed that First Lady Melania played a crucial role in influencing his tougher stance against Putin regarding the Russia-Ukraine war. Melania questioned Trump's optimistic views after his calls with Putin, citing ongoing attacks.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Sudan paramilitary forces kill almost 300 in village raids, say lawyers
description: Rapid Support Forces accused of targeting villages ‘completely empty of any military objectives’ in North Kordofan state as civil war ragesSudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) killed nearly 300 people in attacks in North Kordofan state that began on Saturday, according to Sudanese activists.The RSF has been fighting the Sudanese army in that area, one of the key frontlines of a civil war in Sudan that has raged since April 2023. Continue reading...
author: Reuters

title: Former Nigerian president Muhammadu Buhari dies aged 82 in London
description: Leader who ousted Goodluck Jonathan in 2015 three decades after brief stint as military ruler dies after ‘prolonged illness’Nigeria’s former president Muhammadu Buhari, who led Africa’s most populous country from 2015 to 2023 and was the first Nigerian president to oust an incumbent through the ballot box, died in London on Sunday, a presidential spokesperson has said.President Bola Tinubu’s spokesperson said in a post on X: “President Buhari died today in London at about 4.30pm [1530 GMT], following a prolonged illness.” Continue reading...
author: Reuters in Lagos
